_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Note:  This facility was previously part of the DuPont Sabine River Works Plant.  On April 30, 2004, the facility assets were purchased by INVISTA S.a.r.l. (formerly known as Arteva Specialties S.a.r.l.), a private company owned by a subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.


ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

As a DuPont facility this site operated under DuPont Policies, Standards, and Guidelines which will remain in effect until they are replaced by the INVISTA SHE Policy, Management Systems, and Performance Standards appropriate to the hazard using the Management of Change Process.  Seven of the DuPont Policies, Standards, and Guidelines will remain in effect at the site since DuPont continues to be landlord for the facility.
  
DuPont Policies, Standards, and Guidelines are available in hard copy at the facility.  In addition the Sabine River Works site Emergency Manual lays out the complete Emergency Response Program for the site.


FACILITY DESCRIPTION

The INVISTA Sabine River Works Plant is located approximately 2 miles South of the city of Orange in a rural setting on FM 1006.  The site is located on 72 acres and the facility is secured by a chain-link fence, video cameras, controlled entry, and a 24 hour security force.

The site consists of manufacturing processes to produce Nylon Intermediates (hexamethylenediamine (HMD), adipic acid(Adipure), and Adiponitrile (ADN)).  In the production of these products, the following regulated substances are used as raw materials, intermediates, or by-products:
- Ammonia (anhydrous)
- Chlorine
- Hydrocyanic Acid (HCN)
- 1,3-Butadiene


GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The INVISTA Sabine River Works Plant processes currently follow the requirements of DuPont Corporate SHE Standard S21A, ?Process Safety Management.?  This Standard includes and embraces the requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119 and 40 CFR Part 68.

Our Safety Programs include:

Designin

g for Safety?
- A documented process technology system covers hazards of materials, equipment design basis, and process design basis.
- Extensive accident prevention and mitigation systems are strategically located.
- Applicable codes and standards are met or exceeded.
- Materials of construction are chosen to provide mechanical integrity.
- Quality Assurance ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications and proper assembly.

Maintaining our Plant?
- Maintenance personnel are trained and experienced.
- Contractors are trained and qualified.
- A work permit system controls hazards.

Operating Safety?
- Operators are trained and job qualified.
- Technical resources are available and utilized as required.
- Operators follow approved procedures.

Auditing our Operations?
- Routine safety inspections are conducted
- Corporate, independent and governmental audits and reviews are conducted.
- Process Hazards Analyses are conducted.
- Safety critical equipment is set up on a periodic inspection frequency to ensure ongoing mechanical integrity.
- Pre-startup safety reviews are conducted prior to starting up any new or modified equipment.
- Quality assurance of critical equipment ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications.
- All incidents are investigated and actions taken to prevent recurrence.


THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

- No deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site.
- No known off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage has resulted from a release of any  of the regulated chemicals (Anhydrous Ammonia, Chlorine, Hydrocyanic Acid, or Butadiene) in the past five years.


EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Plant personnel are trained and equipped to respond to any releases of the regulated chemicals.  The program can be summarized as follows:

Training and Preparation?
- Plant personnel receive emergency response training.
- Plant emergency responders, including INVISTA an

d DuPont personnel, are trained.
- Emergency response plans are current.
- Plant participates in emergency drills.
- Critiques are held on drills and actual events.
- Plant is a member of the Orange County Local Emergency Planning Committee

If a Major Release Occurs?
- Emergency alarm is sounded.
- Plant Emergency Operating Center is activated.
- Plant Incident Commander and emergency squad respond.
- Community emergency responders are notified as appropriate.


PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

- Continued focus on reduction of injuries and incidents.
- Embracing INVISTA's principle of ?100% compliance 100% of the time".
- Increasing safety auditing frequency.
- Start-up of Employee Safety Committee to aid in on-site/off-site safety awareness.
